bibl.title: Telegram from [s.n.] Black to the Adjutant General, November 24, 1902

div1.p: Black acknowledges that he has received the instructions regarding the military escort for Reed's funeral. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Telegram from [s.n.] Black to the Adjutant General, November 24, 1902
div1.p:
POSTAL TELEGRAPH-CABLE COMPANY
IN CONNECTION
WITH
THE COMMERCIAL CABLE COMPANY.

JOHN W. MACKAY, President.
J. O. STEVENS, Sec'y.
WM. H. BAKER, V. P. & G. M.

JOHN W. MACKAY, President.
ALBERT BECK, Sec'y.
GEO. G. WARD, V. P. & G. M.

POSTAL TELEGRAPH-CABLE COMPANY
[unclear]
CONNECTION
[unclear]
COMMERCIAL
[unclear]
CABLES.
REGISTERED TRADE MARK.

THE COMMERCIAL CABLE COMPANY
· MACKAY BENNET SYSTEM ·
[unclear]
POSTAL
The Postal Telegraph-Cable Company transmits and delivers this message subject to the terms and conditions printed on the back of this blank.
15 Po Cn K

Received at
WAR DEPARTMENT.
---------------
(WHERE ANY REPLY SHOULD BE SENT.)
Washington, D.C., November 24th, 1902.

Adjutant General, United States Army,
Washington, D.C.
Telegram relative funeral ceremonies Surgeon Reed received.

Black,
Commanding.

MISCELLANEOUS DIVISION
A. G. O.
REC'D
NOV 24
1902.

Filed with 2959 ACP. 800L
463085 AGO
a

Washington Bks.
Nov 24, 1902
Black-Comd'g.

“Telegram relative
funeral ceremonies
Surg. Reed, received”
Recorded Nov 26, 1902

addl
ESN
463085 wr11/25

Received
A. G. O.
M. & R. D.
NOV 25 1902
